content:
Art. 4.235. 
Gifts with encumbrances 
A gift made in the spouses' matrimonial agreement, in favour of the spouses and their common children, may be made subject to an obligation to pay all the debts and charges of the donor's estate without distinction, or subject to other conditions the performance of which depends on the donor's will.
The donee is obliged to fulfil these conditions, unless he prefers to renounce the gift.
Where the donor has, in the spouses' matrimonial agreement, reserved the freedom to dispose of an asset included in the gift of his present assets, or of a fixed sum to be taken from those same assets, that asset or that sum, if he dies without having disposed of it, is deemed to be included in the gift, and belongs to the donee or his heirs.
